message_1: If sin(x) = 0.5, then what is the value of x, in degrees, using the inverse sine function?
message_2:
Using the inverse sine function, we can find the value of x in degrees as follows:

x = sin^(-1)(0.5)

x ≈ 30°

So, the value of x is approximately 30 degrees. Note that this is the principal value. The general solution would be x = 30° + 360°n and x = 180° - 30° + 360°n, where n is an integer.
